newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Harmony says completes Lydex buyout.
newsitem.headline: Harmony says completes Lydex buyout.

text.p: Harmony Gold Mining Co Ltd said on Tuesday more than 90 percent of the non-Harmony shareholders in Lydenburg Exploration Ltd had accepted its offer to acquire their shares.
It said this would give it the majority required to proceed with the compulsory acquisition of the Lydex shares.
Lydex's listing on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange was suspended from Tuesday and was expected to be terminated on March 26 when acquisition formalities were completed.
Harmony acquired 40.4 percent of Lydex last year and offered the remaining shareholders a cash payment of 10 rand per Lydex share plus 45 Harmony options for every 100 Lydex shares held.
Randgold and Exploration Ltd, which has a stake in Harmony, in turn offered to acquire the Harmony options for 8.89 rand cash per option.
